text: The 2017-18 Austrian football championship was the 106th season of a top Austrian league and the 43rd under the name Bundesliga. The league was played by ten teams. They determined the Austrian football champions in four rounds. Lower Austria and Vienna each had two clubs, Burgenland, Carinthia, Upper Austria, Salzburg, Styria and Vorarlberg each had one. Tyrol was the only federal state with no team in Austria's top division TSV Hartberg and FC Wacker Innsbruck were promoted to the Bundesliga. SKN St. Pölten stayed in the Bundesliga after they won in a relegation versus SC Wiener Neustadt. In the 2017-18 season, as in previous years, ten clubs competed against each other in a total of 36 rounds. Each team played twice at home and away against every other team. FC Red Bull Salzburg became Austrian champions for the fifth time in a row and for the twelfth time overall. The sports betting provider Tipico was the main sponsor. The official league name was Tipico-Bundesliga. The TV provider sky Deutschland AG had the rights to show all Bundesliga games in full length. They were broadcasted on Sky Sport Austria channel . ==Final table== Pl. Name M W D L P 1\. FC Red Bull Salzburg 36 25 8 3 83 2\. SK Sturm Graz 36 22 4 10 70 3\. SK Rapid Wien 36 17 11 8 62 4\.
